textos_fuente.text: Ft.Myers magazine - Sanibel Music Festival 2022 top of page HOME — ABOUT US — CIRCULATION & DISTRIBUTION — AD SPECS & PRODUCTION DEADLINES CURRENT ISSUE — CALENDAR — NEWS — COVERS — EDITORIAL ARCHIVES — EDITORIAL ART GALLERY ART GALLERY GUIDE — ATTRACTIONS GUIDE — COLLEGE & UNIVERSITY GUIDE — MUSIC & THEATER SEASON GUIDE 35th Sanibel Music Festival 2022 All concerts at Sanibel Congregational United Church of Christ, 2050 Periwinkle Way. All concerts begin at 7:30pm. For information, call 344-7025. Saturday MARCH 5 Jon Nakamatsu Jon Nakamatsu, American Pianist and Gold Medalist at the 10th Van Cliburn International Piano Competition. Since winning the Cliburn Gold Medal in 1997, Mr. Nakamatsu has toured year-round with leading conductors and orchestras and in recitals and chamber music world-wide. His recording of Gershwin’s ‘Concerto in F’ and ‘Rhapsody in Blue’ topped Billboard’s charts for six months. He serves as Artistic Director of the Cape Cod Chamber Music Festival and is now Artist-in-Residence of the Chautauqua Piano Program. Program: Chopin, Schubert Tuesday MARCH 8 American Chamber Players Piano Trio plus Flute American Chamber Players’ Founder & Artistic Director, longtime NPR music commentator Miles Hoffman, has created a program with a delightful mix of instrumental combinations. Cellist Stephen Balderston is a former Assistant Principal Cello of the Chicago Symphony., Joanna Maurer is an Associate 1st Violinist of the Metropolitan Opera Orchestra.Pianist Anna Stoytcheva won the prestigious Ettore Pozzoli International Piano Competition at age 17. Sara Stern is solo flutist of the 21st Century Consort at the Smithsonian Institution. Program: Gaubert, Ibert, Schubert, Bach, Brahms Saturday MARCH 12 The Boston Trio Pianist Heng-Jin Park, who made her solo debut with the Boston Pops at age 15, is the Trio’s Founding Member and Artistic Director of Halcyon Music Festival. Cellist Jonah Ellsworth has performed as soloist with the Boston Symphony and Boston Philharmonic, among others. Violinist Grace Park is winner of the 2018 Naumberg International Violin competition and is a member of the Lincoln Center Chamber Music Society. Program: Beethoven, Faure, Haydn, Brahms Tuesday MARCH 15 Members of the Julliard String Quartet with Anna Polonsky, piano Guest pianist Anna Polonsky joins the Juilliard following the January death of their distinguished violist, Roger Topping. Founded in 1946 and hailed by The Boston Globe as “the most important American quartet in history,” the ensemble performs in Sanibel as part of a world tour honoring its 75th anniversary. The quartet is in residence at Juilliard, and its members are sought-after teachers in the String and Chamber music faculties. During the summer, they work with students at the Tanglewood Music Center. Program: Mozart, Penderecki, Brahms Saturday MARCH 19 Ken Broberg American Pianist Ken Broberg is the Silver Medalist at the 15th Van Cliburn International Piano Competition in 2017, followed by a bronze medal at the 2019 International Tchaikovsky Competition. Mr. Broberg’s most recent honor was winning first prize in the 2021 American Pianists Awards. Program: Medtner, Faure, Schumann Tuesday MARCH 22 Opera Theater of Connecticut Singing Andrew Lloyd Webber ‘Singing Andrew Lloyd Webber: Superstar of Song and Stage,’ features the music of Jesus Christ Superstar, ‘‘Cats,’ ‘Evita,’ and ‘Phantom of the Opera.’ Webber’s honors include a knighthood, seven Tony Awards, three Grammy awards and an Oscar. Alan Mann, noted speaker and opera historian, hosts the concert with humorous and informed narratives. Saturday MARCH 26 Emerson String Quartet The Emerson’s list of achievements spans more than four decades, more than 30 acclaimed recordings, nine Grammys (including two for the Best Classical Album), three Gramophone Awards, the Avery Fisher Prize, and Musical America’s ‘Ensemble of the Year.’ They were inducted into the Classical Music Hall of Fame in 2010. In 2015, the Emerson received The Richard J. Bogomolny National Service Award, the highest award in classical chamber music. Program: Beethoven, Schubert Tuesdays MARCH 26 & April 5 Emerging Artists Series Florida Gulf Coast University Bower School of Music String Ensembles Under the direction of Dr. Kyle Szabo, head of strings studies and Orchestra Director at FGCU. Emerging Artist Series concerts are free, donations encouraged. March/April 2022 ftmyersmagazin e@icloud.com 516-652-6072 ©2025 by Ft.Myers magazine bottom of page

Bank of the Islands Sponsors Sanibel Music Festival - Sanibel-Captiva Chamber of Commerce Members Skip to content Business Search Calendar of Events Lodging Vacancies Search for: Chambers Healthcare Home Our Chamber About Us Staff Board of Directors Annual Report Job Opportunities News Contact Membership Member Testimonials Member Benefits Marketing Opportunities Directory Join the Chamber Member Login Advocacy John Lai On Deck CAPTAINS FOR CLEAN WATER Legislative Priorities Programs & Events Sanibel 50th Anniversary Previous Next Bank of the Islands Sponsors Sanibel Music Festival Bank of the Islands is proud to support the Sanibel Music Festival as its returning Website Sponsor. The Bank recently made a $1,500 donation in support of the Festival’s online portal for performance details and ticket sales. The Bank’s Sanibel office is also providing in-person ticket sales. Celebrating its 37th anniversary of producing this volunteer-driven annual event, the Festival presents live musical performances of the highest standard at affordable prices, often promoting the careers of emerging artists. “The Sanibel Music Festival is such an important part of our islands’ cultural landscape,” said Richard Shera, Bank of the Islands Vice President, Sanibel-Captiva Office Manager, and Loan Specialist.  “As the Festival’s Website Sponsor, we hope to encourage robust ticket sales and sold-out performances. It’s a great way to show how much we appreciate being your island bank!” All islanders and visitors are encouraged to visit www.sanibelmusicfestival.org to purchase tickets. The 2024 Festival will include six concerts from March 5-23 featuring classical and chamber music, as well as vocal performances. Ticket prices are set at $50 for adults and $25 for students, and discounted packages for multiple performances are also available. Due to ongoing hurricane recovery at its traditional Sanibel venue, this year’s Festival performances will take place at Peace Lutheran Church, 15840 McGregor Blvd, in Fort Myers. Bank of the Islands is located at 1699 Periwinkle Way, at the corner of Casa Ybel Road, on Sanibel. The Captiva office is at 14812 Captiva Drive, next to the Captiva Post Office. As the oldest locally owned and managed community bank on Sanibel and Captiva, Bank of the Islands is proud to be the winner of more than 50 “Best of the Islands” awards over two decades. Jade Nakonetschny 2024-02-19T08:13:37-05:00 February 19th, 2024 | Uncategorized | Share This Story, Choose Your Platform! Home - Sanibel Music Festival Home 2026 Performances Donations About Us Contact FAQ Photo Retrospective My Account Cart Checkout Select Page Tickets are not yet available for purchase. Please click here to be alerted when tickets are available. February 21 : Violins On The Veranda, a virtuosic evening with wine and hors d’oeuvres March 3 : Cliburn International Piano Competition Gold Medalist Aristo Sham of Hong Kong March 7 : Calidore String Quartet, Jeffrey Myers, Violin; Ryan Meehan, Violin; Jeremy Berry, Viola; Estelle Choi, Cello March 10 : Viano String Quartet, Tate Zawadiuk, Cello; Aiden Kane, Viola; Lucy Wang, Violin; Hao Zhou, Violin March 14 : Boston Trio, Pianist Heng-Jin Park, Cellist Jonah Ellsworth, Violinist Irina Muresanu March 21 : Opera Theater of Connecticut Music and Songs of Andrew Lloyd Webber March 24 : Anna Polonsky, Piano; David Shifrin, Clarinet; Peter Wiley, Cello Spring/Summer 2025 Dear Chamber Music Lovers: As the start of Sanibel Music Festival’s 39th season in 2026 approaches, we want to extoll our exciting offerings! The Holiday Luminary concert at our venue of Sanibel Congregational Church, on December 5th, 2025, will mark the beginning of the island’s holiday celebration and the commencement of our musical season. Sanibel Music Festival believes in the transformative power of world-class chamber music and is pleased to present, on March 3rd, 2026, as our opening concert, Aristo Sham, the Gold Medalist Winner of the Cliburn International Piano Competition. Continuing our tempo and crescendo through the month of March, we will welcome Calidore String Quartet on March 7th. Rhapsodized by the New York Times, they are “deep reserves of virtuosity and irrepressible dramatic instinct.” A reprise in 2026 by the Viano String Quartet, who we welcomed in 2023 to rave reviews, will delight us on Tuesday, March 10th. Boston Trio follows on March 14th extolled by the Palm Beach Daily News as “… an energetic program characterized by passion and youthful enthusiasm.” Continuing with the rhythm and momentum of our dynamic March, Opera Theater of Connecticut will showcase the Music and Songs of Andrew Lloyd Webber. As a grand finale to the season, we greatly anticipate the Polonsky-Shifrin-Wiley Trio. The piano, cello, and clarinet trio was formed in 2019 as a collaboration of three distinguished and established artists. Make an impact by assisting in SMF’s continued mission to enrich and stay “in tune with” the cultural life of Sanibel Island! We continue to expand our community outreach efforts. In addition to supporting emerging artists and initiating collaborative projects with community businesses and non-profits, we strive to make our high-quality concerts accessible to all. Sanibel Music Festival is a 501 c3 organization, which allows your contribution to be considered tax-deductible. Please consult with your tax advisor for the best advice. Stay tuned to our website for ticket information as well as money-saving ticket packages for our 2026 season! Online ticket purchases will generate a scan code and an email confirmation, both of which can be used not only to expedite your entry into the concert venue but also will serve as an ecologically friendly way to present your tickets in the true Sanibel spirit! “Chordially yours” Deborah Larson and Shirley Witte Co-Presidents Sanibel Music Festival PO Box 1623 Sanibel, FL 33957 239-344-7025 2026 CONCERT VENUE UCC Sanibel Congregational Church 2050 Periwinkle Way, Sanibel, FL 33957 NEW! CLICK HERE FOR Donor Information E-mail: [email protected] www.SanibelMusicFestival.org MISSION STATEMENT The mission of the Festival is to present classical music of the highest standard and to promote the careers of emerging artists through performance opportunities at affordable prices. SANIBEL MUSIC FESTIVAL FACTS The Sanibel Music Festival was founded in the 1980’s by Marilyn Lauriente, musician and impresario. The Festival has presented such wonderful artists as: The Emerson String Quartet, Olga Kern, Opera Theater of Connecticut, David Finckel, Wu Han, The Juilliard String Quartet, Orion Weiss, Joyce Yang, Jon Nakamatsu, Ruth Laredo, the American String Quartet, the Pacifica Quartet, and the Prazak Quartet. The Festival presents a concert series each season, featuring chamber music, piano, and vocal ensemble, as well as outreach and education programs. HOSTING OPPORTUNITIES FOR 2026 The privilege of hosting an artist in your home is a wonderful opportunity to be “up close and personal” with world-famous artists. This also affords the host some special perks at the accompanying concert. Contact Deborah Larson for details and to choose your dates and artists for hosting. Call or Text: 703-966-9474 . Email: [email protected] “A COPY OF THE OFFICIAL REGISTRATION AND FINANCIAL INFORMATION MAY BE OBTAINED FROM THE DIVISION OF CONSUMER SERVICES BY CALLING TOLL-FREE WITHIN THE STATE. 1-800-HELP-FLA (435-7352) OR www.FloridaConsumerHelp.com . REGISTRATION DOES NOT IMPLY ENDORSEMENT, APPROVAL, OR RECOMMENDATION BY THE STATE.” FLORIDA REGISTRATION CH2935 About Us Contact FAQ Media Photo Retrospective Website Design by Total Concept, Inc. Home - Sanibel Music Festival Home 2026 Performances Donations About Us Contact FAQ Photo Retrospective My Account Cart Checkout Select Page Tickets are not yet available for purchase. Please click here to be alerted when tickets are available. February 21 : Violins On The Veranda, a virtuosic evening with wine and hors d’oeuvres March 3 : Cliburn International Piano Competition Gold Medalist Aristo Sham of Hong Kong March 7 : Calidore String Quartet, Jeffrey Myers, Violin; Ryan Meehan, Violin; Jeremy Berry, Viola; Estelle Choi, Cello March 10 : Viano String Quartet, Tate Zawadiuk, Cello; Aiden Kane, Viola; Lucy Wang, Violin; Hao Zhou, Violin March 14 : Boston Trio, Pianist Heng-Jin Park, Cellist Jonah Ellsworth, Violinist Irina Muresanu March 21 : Opera Theater of Connecticut Music and Songs of Andrew Lloyd Webber March 24 : Anna Polonsky, Piano; David Shifrin, Clarinet; Peter Wiley, Cello Spring/Summer 2025 Dear Chamber Music Lovers: As the start of Sanibel Music Festival’s 39th season in 2026 approaches, we want to extoll our exciting offerings! The Holiday Luminary concert at our venue of Sanibel Congregational Church, on December 5th, 2025, will mark the beginning of the island’s holiday celebration and the commencement of our musical season. Sanibel Music Festival believes in the transformative power of world-class chamber music and is pleased to present, on March 3rd, 2026, as our opening concert, Aristo Sham, the Gold Medalist Winner of the Cliburn International Piano Competition. Continuing our tempo and crescendo through the month of March, we will welcome Calidore String Quartet on March 7th. Rhapsodized by the New York Times, they are “deep reserves of virtuosity and irrepressible dramatic instinct.” A reprise in 2026 by the Viano String Quartet, who we welcomed in 2023 to rave reviews, will delight us on Tuesday, March 10th. Boston Trio follows on March 14th extolled by the Palm Beach Daily News as “… an energetic program characterized by passion and youthful enthusiasm.” Continuing with the rhythm and momentum of our dynamic March, Opera Theater of Connecticut will showcase the Music and Songs of Andrew Lloyd Webber. As a grand finale to the season, we greatly anticipate the Polonsky-Shifrin-Wiley Trio. The piano, cello, and clarinet trio was formed in 2019 as a collaboration of three distinguished and established artists. Make an impact by assisting in SMF’s continued mission to enrich and stay “in tune with” the cultural life of Sanibel Island! We continue to expand our community outreach efforts. In addition to supporting emerging artists and initiating collaborative projects with community businesses and non-profits, we strive to make our high-quality concerts accessible to all. Sanibel Music Festival is a 501 c3 organization, which allows your contribution to be considered tax-deductible. Please consult with your tax advisor for the best advice. Stay tuned to our website for ticket information as well as money-saving ticket packages for our 2026 season! Online ticket purchases will generate a scan code and an email confirmation, both of which can be used not only to expedite your entry into the concert venue but also will serve as an ecologically friendly way to present your tickets in the true Sanibel spirit! “Chordially yours” Deborah Larson and Shirley Witte Co-Presidents Sanibel Music Festival PO Box 1623 Sanibel, FL 33957 239-344-7025 2026 CONCERT VENUE UCC Sanibel Congregational Church 2050 Periwinkle Way, Sanibel, FL 33957 NEW! CLICK HERE FOR Donor Information E-mail: [email protected] www.SanibelMusicFestival.org MISSION STATEMENT The mission of the Festival is to present classical music of the highest standard and to promote the careers of emerging artists through performance opportunities at affordable prices. SANIBEL MUSIC FESTIVAL FACTS The Sanibel Music Festival was founded in the 1980’s by Marilyn Lauriente, musician and impresario. The Festival has presented such wonderful artists as: The Emerson String Quartet, Olga Kern, Opera Theater of Connecticut, David Finckel, Wu Han, The Juilliard String Quartet, Orion Weiss, Joyce Yang, Jon Nakamatsu, Ruth Laredo, the American String Quartet, the Pacifica Quartet, and the Prazak Quartet. The Festival presents a concert series each season, featuring chamber music, piano, and vocal ensemble, as well as outreach and education programs. HOSTING OPPORTUNITIES FOR 2026 The privilege of hosting an artist in your home is a wonderful opportunity to be “up close and personal” with world-famous artists. This also affords the host some special perks at the accompanying concert. Contact Deborah Larson for details and to choose your dates and artists for hosting. Call or Text: 703-966-9474 . Email: [email protected] “A COPY OF THE OFFICIAL REGISTRATION AND FINANCIAL INFORMATION MAY BE OBTAINED FROM THE DIVISION OF CONSUMER SERVICES BY CALLING TOLL-FREE WITHIN THE STATE. 1-800-HELP-FLA (435-7352) OR www.FloridaConsumerHelp.com . REGISTRATION DOES NOT IMPLY ENDORSEMENT, APPROVAL, OR RECOMMENDATION BY THE STATE.” FLORIDA REGISTRATION CH2935 About Us Contact FAQ Media Photo Retrospective Website Design by Total Concept, Inc. Copyright © 2025 Sanibel Music Festival

About Us - The Music Summer School and Festival Skip to content 2025 Courses 2025 Concerts Register/Booking Accessibility 2025 Courses 2025 Concerts Register/Booking Home About Us About Us Archive 2024 Close About Us Archive 2024 Close How it all works Register/Booking Bursaries Accommodation Gresham’s Holt in Norfolk Travel Volunteers Close Register/Booking Bursaries Accommodation Gresham’s Holt in Norfolk Travel Volunteers Close News Support Us Who We Are Contact Us What are you looking for today? No results found, please try another search...here is something you may be interested in Close 1 of 1 About Us Home » About Us Passion for music The Summer School Foundation is an independent charity (reg.272163), first established in 1976. Until 2023 The Summer School Foundation (formerly The Dartington International Summer School Foundation) worked to support and develop the Dartington International Summer School and Festival, and subsequently the Dartington Music Summer School and Festival. We achieved this, thanks to the generous support of our donors and supporters, by providing bursaries for talented young musicians and teachers, enabling them to attend the Summer School; providing funding to establish new courses at the Summer School; supporting capital improvement works at Dartington; providing funds to help underwrite the core staff and operational costs of the Summer School; and providing advice and support to the Summer School team. The Summer School Foundation has also worked to ensure the legacy of the Summer School is preserved and celebrated, having created the Summer School archive and, most recently, having placed this in the care of the British Library. In 2023 the Foundation set out to secure the future of the Summer School at a new location. We are delighted to have found a wonderful setting at Gresham’s School in stunning North Norfolk. The Music Summer School and Festival will operate from 2nd to 16th August 2025 at Gresham’s School , Holt, Norfolk. Gresham’s (which counts Benjamin Britten, Lennox Berkeley and W H Auden amongst its alumni) provides a fabulous base for the Summer School, with stunning performance and rehearsal facilities along with relaxing and comfortable residential accommodation for participants, all surrounded by beautiful grounds and woodlands. The picturesque Georgian market town of Holt is less than 10 minutes walk from the school whilst the North Norfolk coast is just 4 miles away. Concerts, talks and events take place every day throughout The Music Summer School and Festival, across a range of different spaces including the Auden Theatre, the Fishmongers’ Recital Hall in the Britten Music Building, the Dyson Building, the Chapel, and the wonderfully atmospheric outdoor Theatre in the Woods. The Music Summer School and Festival features a range of courses for participants including Choir, Vocal Ensembles and Chamber Choir, Opera Scenes, Improvisation, Chamber Music, Baroque Orchestra, Wind Ensemble, String Ensemble, Early Music, Composition, Instrumental and Vocal Workshops and Masterclasses and much more. The Summer School Foundation Buttermead, Manaton Newton Abbot Devon TQ13 9XG Home Privacy Policy Contact Us Sign Up to Our Mailing List Booking Terms and Conditions Sitemap Call Us: 01263 586 320 Email Us: info@mssf.org.uk Contact Us The Summer School Foundation.
